title: Could Brian Thomas Jr. be a legitimate trade target for Patriots this offseason?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Brian Thomas Jr. recorded over 1,200 receiving yards in his first season with the Jacksonville Jaguars.
Patriots seek offensive upgrades to support QB Drake Maye after postseason struggles, potentially targeting Thomas Jr. as a trade option.
Thomas Jr.'s production fell in 2025, but he remains a desirable trade target due to his past performance as a top deep-threat.

title: 3 takeaways from Team USA men’s hockey’s OT win over Sweden in Olympics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Quinn Hughes scored the overtime winner for Team USA, securing a 2-1 victory over Sweden in the Olympic quarterfinals.
Team USA advances to face Slovakia in the semifinals; Canada will take on Finland in the other semifinal match.
Bruins' Charlie McAvoy played without a face shield, delivering physical play as Team USA's top pairing defenseman.

title: Pittsfield armored vehicle company is largest ICE contract in Mass.
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Lenco Industries in Pittsfield secured $5.2 million in contracts with ICE, the largest in Massachusetts.
The company's BearCat vehicles are used in high-profile ICE operations, receiving state grants to boost production.
Governor Maura Healey encourages companies to avoid ICE contracts, but Lenco's deals remain largely unscrutinized.

title: Former State Police union head, lobbyist get more prison time for fraud, racketeering
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dana Pullman and Anne Lynch were sentenced for racketeering, fraud, obstruction of justice, and tax crimes in Massachusetts.
Pullman received a two-year prison sentence, Lynch 15 months, both followed by one year of supervised release.
Pullman used union funds for personal expenses; Lynch paid him a $20,000 kickback, hiding income from the IRS.

title: Boston 25 News head meteorologist Kevin Lemanowicz departing after 3 decades with the station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kevin Lemanowicz, chief meteorologist at Boston 25 News, will leave his position after 30 years on February 27.
Lemanowicz joined Boston 25 News in 1996 and has reported on major weather events like the 2011 tornadoes and 2023 flooding.
Boston 25 praised Lemanowicz's commitment to accurate forecasting and deep community connections throughout his tenure.

title: Red Sox release statement after outcry over flawed jersey design
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox faced backlash from fans over design flaws in 2026 home white jerseys featuring overlapping lettering and red striping.
The team acknowledged the issue, stating that Fanatics accurately produced jerseys to specifications, with adjustments made for more spacing.
Revised jerseys will be ready for the April 3 home opener against the San Diego Padres at Fenway Park.

title: Pawtucket police find firearms in ice rink shooter’s storage locker, identify ‘courageous citizens’ who intervened
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Pawtucket police found firearms and ammunition in Robert Dorgan's storage locker after the ice rink shooting.
Robert Dorgan shot and killed his ex-wife and son at Pawtucket's Dennis M. Lynch Arena over a family dispute.
Bystanders Michael Black, Robert Rattenni, and Ryan Cordeiro subdued the shooter; others provided critical first aid.

title: MBTA announces service changes and suspensions for March
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: MBTA will suspend Orange Line service from Back Bay to Forest Hills from Feb. 28 to March 8 for upgrades.
Four Commuter Rail lines face weekend suspensions through March for North Station Terminal Area Signal Systems Improvement Project.
Shuttle buses and alternative routes are provided, with travel times extended by up to 70 minutes for some riders.

title: Rafael Devers reacts to Red Sox exec’s ‘pick up a glove’ comment
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rafael Devers addresses Red Sox chairman Tom Werner's comments, choosing not to dwell on past disagreements with the team.
Tom Werner criticized Devers for unwillingness to play first base after an injury to Red Sox's Triston Casas.
Devers, now with the Giants, batted .236 with 20 home runs and 51 RBI in 90 games last season.

title: Adam Schefter maps out potential price for Patriots in Maxx Crosby trade
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots are reportedly interested in acquiring Raiders' pass rusher Maxx Crosby this offseason.
ESPN's Adam Schefter warns that the Raiders would demand a significant trade package, similar to the one for Micah Parsons.
Crosby's dissatisfaction with the Raiders relates to injury management and communication issues involving Tom Brady's trainer.
